This Man #3

This Man Confessed

Jodi Ellen Malpas

4.37
85,651 ratings4,355 reviews
Rate this book
THE STUNNING CONCLUSION TO THE THIS MAN TRILOGY!

The Manor, the very place where their passionate love affair began, fills with guests on what should be the happiest day of Ava and Jesse's lives. She has accepted that she'll never tame the fierceness in Jesse-and she doesn't want to. Their love is profound, their connection powerful, but just when she thinks that she's finally gotten beneath his guarded exterior, more questions arise, leading Ava to believe that Jesse Ward may not be the man she thinks he is. He knows too well how to take her to a place beyond ecstasy . . . but will he also drive her to the brink of despair? It's time for this man to confess.

About the author

Jodi Ellen Malpas

52 books20.3k followers
#1 New York Times & Sunday Times Bestselling Author Jodi Ellen Malpas was born and raised in England, where she lives with her husband, her boys, and Theo the Doberman.

Writing powerful love stories with fierce, memorable characters is her passion – a passion that has taken her on an amazing journey into the world of romantic fiction. Her work is now published in more than twenty-six languages across the world.

~ Becs ~
671 reviews · 2,166 followers
July 3, 2013
Live NOW at Amazon UK



Jodi Ellen Malpas first appeared on our horizons in October 2012 with a fairly quiet release for This Man which began, rapidly, to snowball as readers, reviewers and bloggers all started to rave about this wonderful, bossy, demanding and a little bit crazy new hero – Jesse Ward, Lord of the Sex Manor. By the time January came around anticipation for the release of the second book in the trilogy, Beneath This Man, had reached fever pitch and it’s no different this time as we’ve waited with bated breath for the thrilling conclusion to this amazing trilogy and let me take a moment here to lay some of your anxieties to rest. This Man Confessed is just about everything you could have ever possibly hoped it would be and yet more.

This was really very special. I was so looking forward to losing myself once again in Jesse and Ava’s sexy world and it absolutely didn’t disappoint. For me, this erotic trilogy stands above ALL others. I love Jesse and Ava SO much, I feel so incredibly connected to them and I am now finding it hard to let go. I’ve got to know them so well, become so invested in their story that they have become quite simply unforgettable. They’ll be an incredibly hard act to follow and this book most probably will leave you with the book hangover to end all book hangovers. I know it did for me!



I read slowly, trying to savour every word, sadly watching the progress on my Kindle edge ever closer to 100% knowing that I was going to be leaving Jesse & Ava behind, not wanting to part with them. The sun even graced me with its presence as I read this one, something that doesn’t happen very often in England, and I now have the fondest memories of reading this one sprawled on a sun lounger, completely lost in their world as reality just fell away and all that existed for me were the words on the page. Not many books are able to do this to me – this one really is that special.

Jesse is back in all his fresh water minty loveliness, Lord of the Sex Manor, an impossible, bossy, demanding, uber-possessive, neurotic yet so very, very sexy ex-playboy. He’s still overbearing, unreasonable, challenging but, heck, how much do I love him?


Ava’s still swearing like a sailor and prompting Jesse to yell at her to watch her mouth. The sense fucks, reminder fucks, sleepy sex – they’re all back to be joined by the compromise fuck and sleepy twilight sex. We have incredibly ambient kinky sex at The Manor, a super sexy game of strip poker and, as usual, Jesse is confidently dominant and trying hard to stay in charge.


This is an angst ridden journey with lots of shocks and gasp out loud moments and plenty of despair for the two of them which all makes their Happy Ever After all the sweeter. Jesse has a troubled history full of pain, guilt and sorrow that he will finally confess to and Ava is helping to heal all that hurt and suffering. She’s his little piece of heaven and she’ll never allow him to fall back into that harsh, hollow past but you can be sure that if there’s an easy way to do things, Jesse & Ava won’t do it this way as we embark on yet another rollercoaster of a journey with them. They’re both incredibly argumentative and both want their own way and they’re always quick to anger and shout at each other and watch out for a thrilling, pulsating conclusion so enthralling that I could hardly breathe as I read it – thankfully all followed by a wonderful epilogue.

This is, quite simply, just a beautiful love story. It all felt so incredibly real to me – nobody is perfect, everybody has flaws, they face difficulties together, they scream and yell at each other, fight like cat and dog, overcome those difficulties together and, most importantly, they love one another wholeheartedly and, however painful that seems to be, that is the overriding factor here – the central theme to the whole wonderful story that is the This Man trilogy.

Jesse is incredibly intense – oh to be on the receiving end of all that intensity that is Jesse Ward. His love for Ava has completely overwhelmed him and he is terrified that he could lose her and this is what's causing all this protectiveness and his possessiveness that is driving Ava crazy! This may well be the most beautiful love story ever written.

I very much enjoyed the writing style and I feel like I’ve been in safe hands – I felt that this story was meticulously mapped out and that Jodi knew from the very first page of This Man, exactly where this story was going, where every character fitted in and how it was all going to end. The story and characters strayed true throughout and this, for me, is the hallmark of a talented writer. Even though I am sad to leave behind Jesse & Ava, I am looking forward to whatever Jodi does next. I’ll definitely be reading it.


So, in conclusion, this is quite possibly the best erotic romance trilogy EVER written, the most intense hero I think you will ever read and this book is up there contending for my book of the year for 2013. This is special – you are all going to love it.

5 sexy as fuck stars!

For more reviews, please visit Sinfully Sexy Book Reviews or visit us on Facebook.

July 4, 2013
5 STARS ... END OF.







I finally got my hands on 'This man confessed' and i'm still riding on central Jesse cloud nine. I have never been more excited about a release of a book, the story of Jesse and Ava and there unrelenting relationship wraps up in this epic finale and I worshipped every page.

Jodi ellen Malpas goes on my list of favourite authors she has two hugely redeeming qualities, number one: she is gorgeously British and proud of it, delivering (and not apologising for) her wonderful British-isms and number two: she delivered to the world Jesse Ward, a character never to be forgotten and never to be created again, so with all that gushing being said here are my over zealous book thoughts, welcome to 'This man confessed' as seen through my eyes ...

What's it all about ...
Well if you have got to this point and still haven't realised 'This man confessed' is the last book in a trilogy where we are thrown into the world of Jesse Ward and Ava O'Shea. At his point we have been through a myriad of ups and downs to form one hugely epic love story. 'This man confessed' takes right off from its predecessor 'Beneath this man', Jesse and Ava are now taking steps to further their relationship and commitment to each other, the story continues to uncover secrets, future stumbling blocks and more sexual encounters than you could shake a stick at.

What I loved?
To start with I was impressed with the consistency of story, and character development. The author stays true to the original premise and I found her writing continually witty and engaging. I can't deny that the biggest pull for me in this trilogy is Mr Jesse Ward, hands off readers he's MINE, I can't gush or talk favourably enough about this fictional hero, he's as sexy as he is infuriating and I'm more than a little sad to say goodbye. I also loved the drama and suspense of the series, secrets were popping out about the characters right until the end, this author knows how to keep her readers entertained. This book hands, feet and any other body parts that you want to put down has the sweetest, most gorgeous epilogue I've ever read, I left this story with a huge smile and a hankering for more of this authors writing.




Final thoughts ...
The final book in a trilogy is always tinged with a little sadness for me, when you invest in characters and love what an author does to make a story come alive, it is inevitable that the reader wants to savour the last moments. I couldn't have enjoyed this conclusion more, if you haven't started this series ... What are you waiting for jump aboard readers you won't won't to get off central Jesse cloud nine.

With all that laid out on the table, you know I love this series and Mr Jesse Ward our impossible, overbearing, demanding, unreasonable but equally gorgeous, commanding and protective lord of the manor ...




Re read anyone?

*A HUGE kiss and THANK YOU to my Goodreads girls, Christy and the Pink Ladies for the buddy read, we share a love for Jesse Ward together and I LOVED it ... Watch your fcuking mouths ladies.*

Miss H
49 reviews · 207 followers
April 20, 2017
This review is likely to contain spoilers, by which I mean they’re everywhere.

If I could give this book zero stars, I would.

I don’t know what I was thinking when I decided it’d be a good idea to read this. I mean, after all, I wasn’t exactly a fan of the first two books. Can I plead temporary insanity? I’m going to chalk it up to it being one of those cases where it was so bad I couldn’t stop reading—and that goes for the trilogy as a whole. Apparently, it would seem, I’m an even bigger glutton for punishment.

Anyway, I’m just going to jump right in.



This drivel is not romance. Nothing about this book, or trilogy rather, is romantic by any stretch of the imagination.

This Man Confessed opens up on the day of Ava’s wedding—two whole weeks after the end of Beneath This Man. As usual, Jesse has gotten his way. Shocking, I know. They’re getting married at the Manor. Ava has had no involvement in any of the wedding planning, no input whatsoever. No shower or bachelorette party for this bride-to-be. She’s rather blasé about the whole affair. I guess that’s to be expected since, you know, she’s too busy worrying about her unsuspecting family stumbling upon something they’re not supposed to see like, say, an orgy. They’re under the impression that the wedding is taking place at Jesse’s country retreat. Ava’s poor mom is so clueless and proud of the venue, praising it to the high heavens, that she’s taken to giving tours to wedding guests.

By this point, I was already bored. It was a lesson in patience just to get through the wedding day. It was overly long and boring, if I’m being honest. It was multiple chapters of nothing but filler: preparations, Jesse acting his usual psychotic self, drama on top of drama, and a million other useless things, only for the actual wedding to be glossed over—but not before we get to watch Jesse march down the aisle to snatch Ava from her father’s arms and handcuff himself to her. Up until that point, I thought, just for a moment, that Ava would finally see the light, smarten up, and leave his crazy-ass at the altar. Then I thought, “Who am I kidding?” Next thing you know, the scene skips to the reception, where more crazy antics ensue.

Speaking of crazy antics, why are Ava and Kate friends again? Kate is one of the worst friends imaginable. She can’t even manage to be a decent maid of honor. She was drunk long before the wedding even began. At one point, during the reception, Ava escapes to the bathroom, only to discover that Kate is busy having sex in one of the stalls and the guy most certainly isn’t Sam, her current boyfriend.

I was pretty much disgusted with Ava’s behavior from start to finish. After Jesse confesses to stealing her birth control pills, which she already knew, she finally decides to get mad. She rants and raves about how she doesn’t want a baby and “how dare he do this to her?” I like how she puts the blame all on him, as if she wasn’t a willing participant each and every time they had unprotected sex. Let’s not pretend it was a one-time incident either. It happened on numerous occasions, multiple times a day.



As is her habit, she does the mature thing by running away from her problems because, yes, that clearly solves everything. Before she leaves her new husband, she slaps him across the face. By the way, they haven’t even been married an entire week by this point. She eventually gets it together enough to have her pregnancy confirmed, for all the good it does. Without an ounce of regret or remorse, she lies to Jesse about the results. Later, back at Kate’s place, where she’s been staying, she treats herself to a big glass of wine, her first of many throughout the book. Her life is horrible, don’t you know? Being married to a billionaire is hard work. Never mind the fact that she will never want for anything, has the job of her dreams and, oh yeah, she’s knocked up. She deserves a drink, dammit. To hell with being pregnant. Kate being the smart, awesome friend that she is, decides to help get Ava out of her funk by taking her to a bar, where Ava gets completely wasted. I’m talking stumbling, falling-down drunk.

I can understand her initial shock about the pregnancy, but at the same time, given her strong reaction to the news, throwing a pity party for herself by indulging in alcohol as a way of revenge does little in the way of her likeability.



This is Ava we’re talking about, however. We all know she won’t stay mad for long and will run back to Jesse before it’s all said and done, where they'll find something else to fight about. Rise and repeat.



Both before and after they reconcile, several chapters are dedicated to Ava’s incessant whining about how her pregnancy has ruined her life. The most important of which is the fact that she can no longer perform oral sex without getting sick. She turns it into such a big deal, you’d think the world was coming to an end.



I think most of my dislike boils down to the fact that Ava is a terrible heroine. She possesses more bad traits than good. It seems all she’s capable of is drinking, arguing with Jesse, being a pushover, and getting easily deceived.

This Man Confessed is aptly named. Jesse confesses to so many things, many of which seem to come straight out of left field, that it was hard to keep track of them all. Each confession is somehow more outrageous and ridiculous than the one before it. It seemed like the author was trying too hard to redeem him, to excuse away his overabundance of crazy, to somehow make his behavior okay. I’m sorry, but that’s a little hard to do when I read a scene like this:

“‘Zero, baby.’ I’m snatched from my chair before my brain filters the final call of the countdown, and I’m on the floor, wrists pinned above my head and Jesse straddling my waist. My eyes are wide and the restaurant is silent. You could hear a pin drop. I’m staring up at Jesse, who is unashamed and most unconcerned by our surroundings. He’s got me sprawled on the floor in a restaurant. What the fucking hell is he playing at? I dare not even look away from him. I can feel a million sets of shocked eyes drilling into the spectacle Jesse has created. I’m mortified.

‘Jesse, let me up.’ I wouldn’t put much past him, but this? This is way past unashamed. Fucking hell, what if someone tries to pull him off me?

‘I did warn you, baby.’ His face is awash with amusement, while I’m simply horrified. ‘Wherever, whenever.’”




Yeah, that’s totally normal. There’s nothing wrong with a grown man physically restraining his pregnant wife by sitting on her (more or less) in the middle of a crowded restaurant until she relents to whatever it is he’s demanding of her. Is this simpleton for real? Her only concern is to question what may or may not happen should someone come to her aid. These two not only deserve each other, but they both belong in the loony bin.

I never thought I’d say this, but the excessive amount of sex was not to my liking. Several pages were dedicated to each scene, and trust me, there were plenty. It was as if the book was stuck in a repetitive loop. It became so tedious that I started skimming/skipping them altogether. Don’t even get me started on the drama. There was so much, most of it manufactured, that I was a little dazed by the time I finished reading. It was like a soap opera on steroids.

As with the other two books, the editing could use some work, but I guess that’s par for the course.

The epilogue, told from Jesse’s point of view, was awkward. I don’t know many five-year-olds who talk as if they’re fully-grown. The little boy is already a mini Jesse: “Mummy! Watch your mouth!” Needless to say, there were plenty of cringe-worthy moments to be had while reading their happily ever after.
    adult badly-written contemporary

5 Lord of the Manor Loving Stars!



So it’s Monday night at midnight... what am I doing? Thats right, I am awake clicking the refresh screen on amazon to see if ‘This Man Confessed’ is live so I can stay up half the night and read it! I was THAT EXCITED! And let me tell you all- it did not disappoint. The best book in the trilogy by far!

Before I get into my review, let me introduce you to my favorite crazy man JESSE WARD, and all his fabulous qualities that make me love him so!


That about covers it. Get ready to take a ride on the crazy train with Jesse and Ava!
This may not be a conventional review, but this isn’t an conventional book. I couldn’t possibly review it properly without spoiling the hell out of the story, so it will be a little un-proper.

At the end of ‘Beneath This Man’, Ava and Jesse decide to get married. That is right where ‘This Man Confessed’ starts off... If you think you know what is going to happen in this book, think again! There was so much drama, ups and downs, secrets, confessions, and one curveball after another. And I loved every single page!

Jesse Ward is not your average man. He is just AMAZING. All his little sayings that just make me squeal with delight!

Jesse is my favorite crazy mother fucker. I seriously love this man! He is perfection. I don’t care that he told Ava to watch her mouth over 25 times in this book- it’s endearing to me. I just can’t get enough of him! He was better in this book than ever. Jesse in the bedroom is like no other. He always has the power. Always. Anytime, anywhere. LOVE LOVE LOVE HIM!!! I really don’t see how people can say they don’t like Jesse... what is not to like???

Now Ava on the other hand, Ava got under my skin in this book. There were times I wanted to throttle her. She really pissed me off. But she did redeem herself, so thats something.



Ava and Jesse’s relationship has been tested more times than I care to count. They are strong together- if they can endure all they’ve been through, they can get through anything.



When I was finished with this book, I felt completely satisfied. I had no unanswered questions, the epilogue was perfection. I am a little sad that Jesse and Ava’s story is over, but I was so happy with how it ended. This is one of my favorite trilogies. It’s intense, beautiful, emotional and full of drama- Note to the author: I will read ANYTHING you write woman! ANYTHING! Such an amazing journey- READ IT AND LOVE IT!!! END OF-




♥ ♥ ♥ A spectacular buddy read with Lisa Jayne and the Pink Ladies ♥ ♥ ♥

‘Do you feel that?’ He flattens my palms on his chest and holds them there firmly. ‘It was made to love you, Ava. For too long it was useless, redundant, not required. Now it’s gone into overdrive. It swells with happiness when I look at you. It splinters with pain when we fight. And it beats wildly when I make love to you. Maybe I go overboard with my love, but that’s never going to change. ★★★★★! This Man Confessed, book 3 of 3. The conclusion of the in-control yet so out-of-control, Jesse Ward’s intense & imperious romance of Ava O’Shea. A whirlwind tale filled with secrets, lies, villains & suspense plus their captivating love!

“Everything that happens between us is a result of the potent, sometimes poisonous, love we share. It pushes us to behave erratically and unreasonably— both of us.”

This Man Series is the intense, epic saga about Jesse Ward in his relentless pursuit and seduction of interior designer, Ava O’Shea. Their story is filled with covert pasts and hidden agendas! It’s truly a wild, bumpy and emotional ride loaded with intrigue and shockers, undiluted lust and mind-bending sex plus a compulsive and intense love. Be prepared to be swept away by their story!

Books in This Man series should be read in order:
Book 1: This Man
Book 2: Beneath This Man
Book 3: This Man Confessed
Book 4: With This Man

Jesse’s and Ava’s story started when a laidback and reckless playboy Jesse Ward, owner of the Manor, wealthy business man and sex god with debauchery as his middle name, met what he thought was his latest conquest, interior decorator, Ava O’Shea. Instead he falls hard and fast and turns into a controlling, bossy, possessive, desperate and secretive alpha. Book 1 and 2 follow them through the ups and downs of Jesse’s pursuit, in what can best be described as Euphoric Angst.

Jesse, though he demands full control and disclosure, has managed to keep many secret. Some which have been revealed throughout, but most have left us hanging. This Man Confessed (book 3) will uncover them all! Story picks up shortly after the ending of book 2, Beneath This Man.

Follow Jesse and Ava as their relationship is tested time and time again. The suspense in this long-ish conclusion will keep you at the edge of you seat with much to be resolved; New and old villains continue to stir havoc, lies are told and secrets revealed. There are intrigue, surprises, pain, angst, frustration and ultimately joy as their relationship develops and matures into sweet bliss, sprinkled with countless moments of everything that is sex with Jesse. I will say no more. Their saga is best experienced.



Jesse Ward is just what I needed. In fact he is everything that I needed! He has captivated and kept me on “Central Jesse Cloud Nine” throughout. He truly is all pure, sexy, unadulterated alpha! Six words to describe Jesse: Intense, bossy, compulsive, enigmatic, possessive and elusive.

“The flawlessness of his beautiful face will amaze me until the day I die— his lightly tanned skin, his almost girly long lashes, the faint crease across his brow. It would take me a lifetime to run through all his stunning features. My devastating man, in all of his challenging ways.”



Ava O’Shea is everything that Jesse needed and everything we needed to keep the story going. She stood up to him, she succumbed to him, she riled him, she created more drama and she kept the mystery and story going by NOT demanding answers. Six words to describe Ava; Talented, strong, focused, ambitious, stubborn and meek.

“My beautiful girl. My defiant temptress. My lady. My angel. My Ava.”

This Man Series has introduced us to all that is sex with Jesse (or fucks depending on the mood):
Reminder fucks, Sleepy sex, Make friends sex, Shower fucks, Hangover sex, Catching up sex, Sense fucks, Seeing stars fucks, Apology fucks, Possessive fucks, Retribution fucks, Sleepy celebration sex, Alfresco fucks, Proposal fucks and Truth fucks.
And in this story we are introduced to

Euphoric Angst! Intense! Suspenseful! Captivating! Memorable! Epic! What a way to end a series! Thanks for the extensive-ish epilogue from Jesse’s POV! Job well done Ms. Malpas!

“You keep my heart beating, baby. And it will only ever beat for you.”

Fan-fucking-tastic, absolutely perfection!

**fans self**


Maybe I should let myself cool off a tad before writing this review.. Nah, I'll dive in while it's HOT. Yes, this book is HOT. If you loved Jesse Ward in This Man or Beneath This Man, I will be astounded if you don't fall fan-crazy in love with him more in This Man Confessed. He's still got his uber controlling (even more-so in ways) attitude and his "Ava, watch your fucking mouth" hang up but in this book, he's absolutely swoonworthy. He's done a lot of growing up and he knows what he wants....a life with Ava and he will do anything to protect what's his.

So, when I started reading this little gem I was a tad.....


But it took absolutely zero time being a tad (or a LOT)....


But, being a totally SPOILER FREE REVIEW.... I must say there was a lot of....


Hold onto your hats ladies, this book delivers a shit-ton of new information. All the Jesse secrets come out and new conflicts arise in their relationship. Rest assured, you will have a VERY difficult time putting this book down. It's rather long (yeah) and I ate up every word. When I was feeling all sweet and mushy from all of their romantic fluff- BAM, a new twist arises, knocking everything off its axis....



This book is a serious rollercoaster ride of emotions and you will love every minute of it!

In case you've forgotten the whole reason for swooning....


This books picks up sort of where Beneath This Man leaves off....Don't read spoiler if you didn't read the first two books, otherwise, you're safe reading.
It captures you from the get-go their love for each other. Jesse's need for Ava is borderline unhealthy. We all remember those missing pills..... no spoilers here.



I almost wish I had done a re-read of the first two books prior to diving into this. The main reason is there isn't a huge recap of previous events so I found myself thinking "Who was Matt...or Dan...What was Ruth Quinn's deal? What was up with Mikhail?" So if you don't remember those characters, do a re-read as they're back in full force!



For the size of the book, the pacing was awesome. It definitely wasn't like you were sitting back bored waiting for the next shoe to drop. It had a fair mixture of heat (more than fair share), suspense, OMFG moments, but in the end, it all ties together and you're left thinking "Why didn't I figure all this out before?" It's a full circle love story with all kinds of twists and turns. It's very hard to review this book as so much happens, I'm not leaking any spoilers. It needs to be experienced and I would refrain from reading a lot of reviews for that fear of those surprises ruining all the fun of it.



The ending is awesome. In fact, the epilogue is in Jesse's POV. Getting in his head was spectacular. Watching their story go full circle was one hell of a ride. This series will rank up there as one of my favorites for sure.

Did Ava make me uber upset at one point in this book? Hell yes, and you will know what I'm referring to when you get there in this book. But even she has grown up tenfolds over time and her unfailing dedication to their functionally dysfunctional relationship is commendable. As hot as Jesse is, his uber controlling borderline arsehole (shout out to Britishisms) nature would send most women for the hills.

So, go forth and enjoy this one. You won't soon forget it.....

We're not conventional baby.

But we're special. What we have is
really special. You belong to me,and I

for us to be apart, Ava."

I loved being back in the crazy world of Jesse and Ava. Once again Jodi Ellen Malpas does not disappoint in creating a masterpiece full of hot sex, lots of drama, and a love that is loyal and true. The relationship of Jesse and Ava may not be normal to our eyes; but it is "their normal." I adore how they came to that conclusion, that they will never be like everyone else, and that is ok because they created their own bliss. The love and need that they have for one another was heart warming in my eyes, especially because I have watched them grow from the beginning of this often times; chaotic journey. The intensity that Jesse and Ave share is off the charts, and holy cow; the sex scenes in this book melt the words right off the pages!!!LOL! This couple darn well know how to make love and f**k on a whole new level then most. They indulge in all sorts of different types of sex again, but my favorite hands down was the new: "sleepy twilight sex."

I was impressed that even though this was the last book, there was still a lot of loose ends that were tied up beautifully and reveals that were brought up right up until the very end. Some of those reveals were jaw dropping to say the least! There is never a dull moment in the world of Jesse and Ava. I will say that there was a point where I wanted to commit a murder with the way Ava was behaving. There are only a few books where I become so absorbed in the story that I become so involved my emotions run away on me. This is one of them. I am truly sad though to have to say goodbye to this unique couple. I will miss Jesse and his controlling,possessive ways. He is a character that I am sure will be very hard to beat.

Now with great sadness, I say goodbye to Jessa and Ava; and I wish them nothing but happiness, lots of sleepy sex, good times...and let us not forget...many jars of peanut butter!

3, 2, 1, Zero....End of!

The story starts off only two weeks after Beneath This Man and if you've read that, you know what is happening. It is wonderful and...sooo beautiful. And then we get some Jesse confessions but we all knew it was coming. Even though Ava had a good idea, she still comes unglued and rightfully so.

They separate ~again~ and that leads to more drama ~again~ but now we have someone who is after Ava. Naturally, Jesse flips out and unbelievable things take an even worse turn. *It's scenes like this that make me keep reading this series.* Because just when things seem bleak, something wonderful comes out of it.

There's even more confessions and we finally get to know *supposedly* all of Jesse's secrets and boy, are there some doozies! I would love to spill them all but I won't do that to you. ;)

This series is not for everyone though. It is over the top and ridiculous and never in a million years would I ever stand for someone like Jesse in real life but it does make for an interesting story.

The crazy thing ~for me~ wasn't even the over the top stuff...it was all the secrets. Mainly from Jesse but Ava kept things from Jesse as well. It's funny because in the beginning, it seems as if she's the normal one but the more we find out, the more we realize how similar they are. And just when you think all the secrets are out...there's more!




Of course, there is ton of hot sex...I mean, we are talking about Jesse and he is very creative. The good thing is that even though they still name their types of sex (Love Sleepy Twilight Sex), the desperation is gone and they are truly making love. Don't worry...there's still plenty of passion and some rough and hard stuff!

And we do get a lot of answers. We find out about Sarah and Coral and Ruth and if Kate stays with Sam or if she goes with Dan? And who is Sally dating and finally, what in the heck is going on with Mikael!

I was shocked at some of the answers and not surprised at others. I love what Jesse did with The Manor and The Ava Wall. But...my favorite, favorite thing was the epilogue...that was quite lovely and what a great way to end the series!

Jointly reviewed for Totallybookedblog.com

Gitte: What an absolutely bloody perfect end to the crazy, emotional and passionate ride that was the ‘This Man’ trilogy. We’ve had so many theories and questions, and finally we’re let into some pretty heart breaking and tragic secrets. Secrets that answer every single question, and leaves us with an aching heart and a complete understanding of The Lord, The God, The Sexy and Cocky Man that is Mr Jesse Ward.

No spoilers from us as per usual, but you will LOVE the conclusion. It will have you melting, swooning, laughing and crying. Oh, and there are plenty of ‘WHAT?!’ moments too, moments that will have your heart racing and feeling fearful, at the same time. Jodi hit a homerun with Confessed. Pure class! This series just got better and better with each instalment and is without doubt one of my all-time favourite trilogies….and don’t get me started on how much I love Jesse….sigh!!!

“I want everything in the world with you, baby, and I want it all yesterday.” - Jesse

Jenny: Couldn't agree more Gitte. What a brilliant end to a trilogy we have both completely devoured. And you're spot on, because this Trilogy had it all. Questions, intrigue, passion (oh dear god…the PASSION!) - I had so many conspiracy theories going into this installment, my head was spinning. And we were afforded all the answers we've been dying to get to the bottom of. Yep, EVERYTHING was answered and we were handed a whole heap more as well.

"You keep my heart beating, baby. And it will only ever beat for you. Understand?"

No spoilers at all! Everyone needs to experience This Man Confessed in the way the author intended it and I truly hope readers are afforded the opportunity to do just that because I can tell you there were a lot of surprises for me - I did a lot of OMFG's, cried, laughed and fanned myself. What a fantastic read this was. And yes, one of my favorite trilogies that's for sure!

In This Man Confessed we have Mr Ward at his trampling best. Sweet baby Jesus….. that man! I'm devoid of enough words to describe him.

"Oh yes, there he is, my husband, looking like he's just landed from planet fucking perfect."

Indeed he did. And he took the express flight to planet perfect at that! Even though I wanted to throttle The Lord of The Manor at the start of This Man Confessed, this man made me laugh, cry and floored me with his tenderness and love. I can't say enough how much I love this man!

Gitte: So, we start with a wedding, a wedding done Jesse style and we all know what that involves; trampling, controlling behaviour and bucket loads of passion and emotions.

“This man stops me breathing when he touches me and fucks me until I’m delirious. I can’t wait to marry him.”…”He used to cripple me with just his touch. Now he cripples me with his touch and his words. I’m destined for a life of crippling pleasure, melting tenderness and heart stopping emotion. He’s going to incapacitate me at every turn.” – Ava

“Do you feel that?.....It was made to love you, Ava…It swells with happiness when I look at you. It splinters with pain when we fight. And it beats wildly when I make love to you. Maybe I go overboard with my love, but that’s never going to change. I’ll love you this fiercely until the day I die, baby.” - Jesse

So expect to be happily sitting back enjoying that ‘Mario’s Most Marvellous’, watching this happy event unfold whilst completely crushing and clenching. Then….bam the floodgates open and the reader gets swept away in crashing currents of intensity; a thrilling eye opening ride that has so many high’s and low’s by the end I was exhausted. The epilogue though…BEST EVER!! It was GENIUS which you’ll read for yourself! Jodi surpassed any expectations I had and she just nailed it. After three books of drama, obsession, tragedy and passion, I finished with THE biggest smile on my face and tears of laughter still rolling down my cheeks….Actually some of those may have been from the impending loss of leaving behind Ava & Jesse too.

Both Jesse and Ava do some real soul searching, and I suppose, come to realise their own faults and limitations. Ava comes into her element and her strength shines in Confessed. A true heroine. As for Jesse, he just astounds me.

“We’re not conventional baby. But we’re special. What we have is really special. You belong to me, and I belong to you. It just is. It’s not natural for us to be apart, Ava.” - Jesse

Aaaaah, Jesse, well we all know he’s challenging, controlling and obsessive. But I love him for it; Ava loves him for it. The two of them circle each other through the magnetic pull between them. Neither can leave the other alone, never mind over long periods of time. Despite Ava trying to assert herself, needing the distance to sort her head out. The pair of them piss the other off at no end. In reality though, they need each other to breathe, to survive and to live.

In Confessed we see Jesse’s vulnerability, his intense need to protect what’s his because of his past. We see and feel his turmoil and understand his struggles. Some scenes had me in absolute tears as he exposes that vulnerability and uncertainty to Ava.

“You keep my heart beating, baby, but you also make it fucking stop….You said you couldn’t live without me…Then stop trying to kill me off.” – Jesse

“This woman is my fucking life.” - Jesse

Jesse also made me laugh so much in this instalment. I highlighted like crazy but for fear of spoiling the final visit with them, I can’t stick the highlights in here. Just know that this man is on bloody fire with his banter, his thoughts and his wise cracks. That, added to his passionate, arrogant and controlling alpha maleness…well…how on earth can you resist him?!

We find out just why Jesse is the way he is. Not immediately though. We still go through him hiding his past which consequently leaves Ava hiding things from him too. It all comes to a head as people are revealed for who they are and a thrilling drama ensues along with some pretty devastating truths.

“Why did you do it?” – Ava

Because I love you….Everything is because I love you.” - Jesse

Both Ava and Jesse frustrated me at times, they both make mistakes and their decisions are clouded by intense emotions, guilt and regret but ultimately love. However, the pair of them reminded me so many times why I adore and love them as much as I truly do. They are unbreakable!

“Tell me why the fucking hell you did this to me!” - Ava

“Because I wanted to keep you forever.” – Jesse

There are just so many ‘melt your heart into a puddle’ moments in Confessed.

“Today my heart started beating again. Today you became mine.” – Jesse

If you ever doubted the love Jesse and Ava have for each other, well doubt no more. These two will always have a special place in my heart as will Jodi for giving them their voices. Blindingly brilliant conclusion to a fantastic series…FAB-U-LUSH Author!!!

Jenny: I have to start by reiterating what you said about THAT EPILOGUE! Honestly, it was one of THE best epilogues I have read. It exceeded all expectations and I loved it so much I had to go back and read it again straight away. Perfection!

"There are a million things about this man that make me despair, but there are endless things that make me adore him. Some of those despairing things I even adore."

Now Gitte, you and I always chat about books as we're reading them and again when we've finished and we have burned up the phone lines throughout this series and no more so than during and after reading This Man Confessed. We can tell you readers...you will NOT be disappointed in how this series wraps up. Jodi Ellen Malpas has done a stellar job in this Trilogy and talk about bringing it home in this one! Well done Ms Malpas! A true winner! We are still discussing elements of this book and laughing or crying as we do so. Just brilliant!

"Knock yourself out, baby. But please, let's just make this one a verbal trample."

We learn so much about the man himself. So much clicked into place in this installment. Some revelations astounded me, some shocked me, some crushed me. Some I saw coming, some completely blindsided me and I definitely ran the gamut of emotions throughout this whole book.

"…right now when he's pouring his love into me through our mouth contact, is his way of finding the strength. It's his way of ensuring that I'm real before he off loads a past of pain."

The passion between Jesse and Ava is second to none. You feel every emotion, get hot and bothered over the physical exchanges because these two totally burn up the pages and have a front row seat through all their ups and downs. Ava and Jesse are learning about one another and naturally mistakes are made along the way.

To see the growth of these characters throughout the series. To witness their struggles, their heated exchanges, their heartbreaking moments and to have it all culminate and conclude in this outstanding book....just wonderful!

"I don't know how I ever survived without this. I existed, Ava. I didn't live."

Jesse and Ava gave me their all. You feel with every breath you take that theirs is a love to withstand all. The heat, the passion, the intensity, the hilarious banter - these two had me in fits -and Jesse's humour was on fire! Their tender moments…sigh…talk about melting your heart.

I'm still on Central Jesse Cloud Nine and I may never leave! Once again I have to agree with my blog buddy. This Man Confessed. Was. Brilliant. Just. Bloody. Brilliant.

"And no more confessions because I have nothing left to tell."

●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●

"If I want to fuck you hard and make you scream, then I will. If I want to make love to you, Ava, and make you purr, then I will.... You are mine, so I'll do what I like with you."

●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●

He was so über sweet. I could not stop swooning. The things that this man would say! *sigh* But don't worry. He was still plenty demanding and oh so yummy. He was also a barrel of secrets that were finally revealed. We get to see who Jesse really is and why he is the way he is. Like I mentioned in my review of the previous book, I love it when Jesse opens up to Ava. I melted completely. He loves Ava so much that, yeah, it can be a bit too much at times but I absolutely adore him for being that way. I know alot of people think he is crazy (and I admit, I thought he kinda was too), but now that I understand him, I think he is just plain wonderful! I LOVE him! End of.



Jesse may not have seemed so freaking insane in this book, but the story made up for it by introducing some pretty cray cray characters. I couldn't believe the madness that was occuring. It was more entertaining than watching a soap opera. There were moments where I was literally shocked by what was happening. I was speechless. There were just so many things we had yet to learn about Jesse's past. As well as the twists that occured. It was AWESOME!!



●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●

"We're not conventional, baby. But we're special. What we have is really special. You belong to me, and I belong to you. It just is. It's not natural for ust to be apart, Ava.... This is where you're supposed to be."

●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●

Ava finally turned around a bit for me. Although, in the beginning of this book, I totally disliked her. She was so annoying and selfish. But once she saw the light, I actually started to like her. She stuck with Jesse through thick and thin. I greatly appreciated her doing that instead of running away. She even took care of him when he needed it. It was so lovely to see that.



●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●

"I don't demand to see her eyes anymore. I don't need to check she's real. As long as my heart keeps beating, I'll know that she is. End of.

--Jesse

●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●  ●

The ending was SO friggin beautiful! I didn't want it to end. I will miss my crazy neurotic lovable Jesse. I just love him too much!! I was so happy with how everything concluded for them. I felt the series became better with each book. I swooned, I laughed, I teared up, I got angry, and I smiled so big. It was a fantastic read, and if you love Jesse as much as I do.... YOU HAVE TO READ THIS BOOK!!
